ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Past 12 months - participant simultaneously used alcohol and marijuana (SAM)
Notes: 0= No, alcohol-only user; 1= Yes, SAM user

ElementDescription: Past 12 months - frequency participant simultaneously used alcohol and marijuana (SAM)
Notes: 0= Never in the past year; 1= Once a month or less; 2= 2-3 times per month; 3= Once a week; 4= 2-4 times per week; 5= 5-7 times per week

ElementDescription: In the last year, how often did you use alcohol and marijuana at the same time so that their effects overlapped?
Notes: 0= Did not use; 1= Every day; 2= 5 to 6 times a week; 3= 3 to 4 times a week; 4= Twice a week; 5= Once a week; 6= 2 to 3 times a month; 7= Once a month; 8= 3 to 11 times in the past year; 9= 1 or 2 times in the past year
